cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to resume a slow WNW motion overnight, turn NW Tuesday, then curve NE Wednesday night, skirting the Georgia and South Carolina coasts and then accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Closest coastal encounter near the South Carolina coast (near Charleston) – no direct U.S. landfall currently forecast.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Storm Surge Watch from Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Lantana, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA; Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and the Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely at the port late Wednesday into Thursday, with a 33–38% chance of sustained 50-kt winds and a 12% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC guidance indicates 4–7 ft of inundation above ground for areas from Lantana, FL to South Santee River, SC, which includes Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches along the coastal Carolinas, including Charleston, leading to flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents and the possibility of isolated tornadoes as rain-bands sweep inland.
